Package org.cougaar.mts.std.debug

This package contains optional MTS components used for debugging and testing Cougaar internals.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
StepService This MTS-internal Service can be used to 'single-step' a message through the stations.
 

Class Summary
AddressChangeServletComponent This Component tests the MessageTransportRegistryService by invoking its ipAddressChanged method.
ForwardMessageLoggingAspect This test Aspect logs all outgoing messages, including in each log the source and destination Agent, the destination Node, and the destination Host.
MessageTraceAspect This test Aspect logs message delivery elapsed time.
MetricsBlastTestAspect This test Aspect throws lots of data into the metrics service and subscrobes to a formula which uses that data.
MetricsTestAspect This test Aspect queries and updates the metric service on every message send.
ScrambleAspect This test Aspect scrambles the order of messages.
SerializationAspect This is debugging Aspect forces serialization on the LoopbackLinkProtocol.
ServiceTestAspect This test Aspect is an example of using a LinkProtocol-specific service.
StepperAspect This Aspect includes the ServiceProvider for and implementation of the StepService, as well as a use of that service in a Swing gui.
StepperControlExampleAspect This example Aspect shows a simple use of the StepService.
StubDumperAspect This debugging Aspect logs URIs and stubs of local and remote references, respectively.
TraceAspect This demonstration Aspect provides a simple trace of a message as it passes through the various stages of the message transport subsystem.
WasteCPUAspect This debugging Aspect deliberately delays message processing by wasting CPU for pseudo-random durations.
ZinkyMessageTraceAspect  
 

Package org.cougaar.mts.std.debug Description

This package contains optional MTS components used for debugging and testing Cougaar internals. These components are not used in a production Cougaar runtime, but may be used by Cougaar application developers to help debug their inter-agent communications.
